newsitem.title: HONG KONG: HK Telecom to set mortgage-backed FRN.
newsitem.headline: HK Telecom to set mortgage-backed FRN.

text.p: Hong Kong Telecommunications Ltd's HK$800 million staff housing mortgages securities will be launched into syndication next week in the form of floating rate notes, arranger Societe Generale Group said on Friday.
The notes will mature in 2019 and pay an interest margin of 60 basis points over the one-month Hong Kong Interbank Offered Rate.
The expected average life is estimated at 3.5 to four years.
The securitisation will take effect through the Hong Kong Mortgage Financing Co, a special purpose vehicle incorporated in Jersey, the Channel Islands.
Net proceeds will be used to finance Hongkong Telecom's portfolio of staff mortgages.
The notes will be without recourse to Hongkong Telecom and the mortgage loan portfolio will continue to be administered by the Hongkong Telecom Group.
The notes will be guaranteed 100 percent by AAA-rated MBIA Assurance S.A. on the timely payment of interest and ultimate repayment of principal.
The notes are expected to be rated AAAr by Standard & Poor's Corp and Aaa by Moody's Investors Services.
